<span><strong style="color:#000">Markets: </strong></span><span>The stock market was downright nutty this week. A day after Meta suffered the worst one-day drop in value in US stock market history (losing more than $230 billion), Amazon set the record for the biggest one-day </span><span><em>gain </em></span><span>on Wall Street (adding $191 billion). As for the major indexes, the S&P 500 and Nasdaq posted their </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2022/02/03/stock-market-futures-open-to-close-news.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">best week</a></span><span> so far this year.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">Economy: </strong></span><span>The jobs report “hot mess express” that analysts were warning about turned out to be a cool clean adding machine. US employers stunned experts by </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-business-health-pandemics-economy-b1b4e2c2e28d60e5439639a0e2fb8706?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">adding 467,000 jobs</a></span><span> last month, far more than expected and a sign of an extraordinarily strong labor market. In even better news, the government said it had undercounted the number of jobs added in November and December by more than 700,000.</span>
</li>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/02/04/anti-vaccine-demonstrators-continue-to-paralyze-downtown-ottawa-officials-warn-of-occupation?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Occupy Ottawa?
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/02/04/anti-vaccine-demonstrators-continue-to-paralyze-downtown-ottawa-officials-warn-of-occupation?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Supporters arrive at Parliament Hill for the Freedom Truck Convoy to protest against Covid-19 vaccine mandates and restrictions in Ottawa, Canada." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/5f1da9bcb3da7d7bdd3fe536ce06d7c8aacea6ba-1024x683.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Lars Hagberg/AFP via Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A group of protesters rallying against vaccine mandates has paralyzed downtown Ottawa since rolling into town last Friday, using an assortment of trucks to blockade streets and forcing many businesses to close.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">City officials are concerned that with potentially tens of thousands more protesters heading to the Canadian capital this weekend, the self-titled Freedom Convoy is transitioning into a <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/ottawa-fears-vaccine-protest-has-morphed-into-an-occupation-11643986803?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">prolonged occupation</a>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">How did this begin?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A new law that went into effect in January required Covid vaccinations for truckers crossing the US–Canada border. Some truck drivers chafed at the measure, accusing the government of overstepping its bounds.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-02-04/covid-rebellion-brews-in-canada-sending-warning-across-globe?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">snowballed from there</a>, morphing into a broader protest against Covid restrictions and won the backing of prominent folks who’ve long attacked government measures to battle the virus.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Former President Trump and podcaster Joe Rogan have voiced support for the Ottawa protesters, and Elon Musk also decided to chime in: “Canadian truckers rule,” he tweeted last week.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Neither side is backing down. </strong>Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, who said the country was “shocked and frankly disgusted” by the behavior of some protestors, has signaled he’s not lifting Covid restrictions. A spokesperson for the Freedom Convoy said the protests will continue until he does.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bu</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What do Canadians think? </strong>In a poll taken after the trucks started rolling in, the majority of Canadians said they oppose the idea of the protest, while 32% support it. The Canadian Trucking Alliance, an industry group, stated that 90% of Canadian truckers were vaccinated and that the entire industry should “adapt and comply” with the rules.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The Ottawa demonstrations arrive as countries have taken vastly different approaches to managing a virus that appears to be waning (for now). At least three European countries—Sweden, Denmark, and Norway—announced end dates for their Covid rules. Compare that to Austria, which as of today is <a href="https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-health-europe-austria-3f173bbb5dd0b84ad0b0574d119992a4?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">requiring vaccines</a> for all adults.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/meta-metaverse-harassment-personal-boundary-tool?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Meta sets boundaries
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/meta-metaverse-harassment-personal-boundary-tool?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="A screenshot of Meta's Horizon Worlds" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/3a56d8f95d36159d398b59732aecfd41d13a754b-750x480.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Meta</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Meta announced yesterday that it’s rolling out a “personal boundary” tool to <a href="https://www.reuters.com/technology/facebook-owner-meta-adds-tool-guard-against-harassment-metaverse-2022-02-04/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">block avatars</a> from invading a nearly four-foot perimeter around your virtual character in its Horizon VR experiences. Avatars will be halted upon approach and have to “extend their arms to be able to high-five or fist bump” <em>Creation of Adam</em>-style.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Why is it taking this action? Well, harassment has <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-60247542?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">made its way</a> from the realverse → metaverse.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Bloomberg tech reporter Parmy Olson told the BBC that male avatars in Horizon Worlds swarmed around her, stared, took pics, and “zoomed up” to talk directly in her ear.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Another woman, Nina Jane Patel, told the Daily Mail she was sexually assualted in Horizon Venues by male avatars who groped her.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Meta has a storied history of attempting to moderate its social platforms, and digital worlds add another dimension of complexity. CTO Andrew Bosworth told the BBC last year that it “could feel a lot more real to me, if you were being abusive towards me,” but on the flip side, users have the power to mute each other so “you would cease to exist for me and your ability to do harm to me is immediately nullified.”<em>—JW</em></p>
</div>

FOOD & BEV

<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/dominos-pizza-reward-carryout?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Domino’s is going DIY
</font>
</a>
</h1>

<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/dominos-pizza-reward-carryout?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Domino's promo of $3 tip for ordering carryout on app." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/612dfdcc2ec9c7a506461ddcd54decb4f9ae7b28-2554x1436.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Domino's</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s not delivery, it’s Di-do it yourself. Domino’s <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/business/2022/feb/03/dominos-pizza-offers-customers-tips-pick-up-own-pizza?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> this week that customers could earn a $3 “tip” to put toward their next order if they choose takeout instead of delivery.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The largest pizza company in the world isn’t just missing your beautiful face in its stores—the promo comes as the chain is still struggling to hire enough delivery drivers. Last year, CEO Richard Allison blamed staffing shortages (specifically a lack of drivers) for same-store sales falling 1.9% in Q3—the first time quarterly sales dropped since 2011.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Digital orders make up 50% of Domino’s sales. Delivery accounts for about two-thirds of those orders, while one-third are takeout.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Backed into a takeout corner.</strong> The pivot to pickup is really Domino’s only choice. While you can get Little Caesars or Papa John’s on Uber Eats, Domino’s has made it their thing to be anti-delivery apps. Last year the chain handed out over $100,000 in gift cards to random delivery customers for <em>other</em> local restaurants to highlight the third-party delivery fees that smaller restaurants pay. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Another cost-cutting measure…</strong>the chain also took away some of your chicken wings. They cut the size of an order from 10 pieces to eight.<em>—MM</em></p>
</div>

<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/02/04/key-performance-indicators-february-5?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>In less than five years since its launch, Nintendo’s Switch console has <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2022/2/3/22915715/nintendo-earnings-q3-2021-switch-sales-forecast?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">surpassed</a> the Wii in sales. <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Former VP Mike Pence, speaking at the Federalist Society meeting in Florida, forcefully <a href="https://apnews.com/article/mike-pence-donald-trump-election-2020-84ff467d9ff5bfaad084e274f69ac521?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pushed back</a> on false claims made by Trump that Pence could have somehow overturned the 2020 presidential election.</p>

US employers stunned experts by \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-business-health-pandemics-economy-b1b4e2c2e28d60e5439639a0e2fb8706?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eadding 467,000 jobs\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e last month, far more than expected and a sign of an extraordinarily strong labor market. Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA group of protesters rallying against vaccine mandates has paralyzed downtown Ottawa since rolling into town last Friday, using an assortment of trucks to blockade streets and forcing many businesses to close.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCity officials are concerned that with potentially tens of thousands more protesters heading to the Canadian capital this weekend, the self-titled Freedom Convoy is transitioning into a \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/ottawa-fears-vaccine-protest-has-morphed-into-an-occupation-11643986803?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eprolonged occupation\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHow did this begin?\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA new law that went into effect in January required Covid vaccinations for truckers crossing the US–Canada border. Some truck drivers chafed at the measure, accusing the government of overstepping its bounds.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-02-04/covid-rebellion-brews-in-canada-sending-warning-across-globe?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esnowballed from there\u003c/a\u003e, morphing into a broader protest against Covid restrictions and won the backing of prominent folks who’ve long attacked government measures to battle the virus.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFormer President Trump and podcaster Joe Rogan have voiced support for the Ottawa protesters, and Elon Musk also decided to chime in: “Canadian truckers rule,” he tweeted last week.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNeither side is backing down. \u003c/strong\u003ePrime Minister Justin Trudeau, who said the country was “shocked and frankly disgusted” by the behavior of some protestors, has signaled he’s not lifting Covid restrictions. A spokesperson for the Freedom Convoy said the protests will continue until he does.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBu\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat do Canadians think? \u003c/strong\u003eIn a poll taken after the trucks started rolling in, the majority of Canadians said they oppose the idea of the protest, while 32% support it. The Canadian Trucking Alliance, an industry group, stated that 90% of Canadian truckers were vaccinated and that the entire industry should “adapt and comply” with the rules.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Ottawa demonstrations arrive as countries have taken vastly different approaches to managing a virus that appears to be waning (for now). At least three European countries—Sweden, Denmark, and Norway—announced end dates for their Covid rules. Compare that to Austria, which as of today is \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-health-europe-austria-3f173bbb5dd0b84ad0b0574d119992a4?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erequiring vaccines\u003c/a\u003e for all adults.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMeta announced yesterday that it’s rolling out a “personal boundary” tool to \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/technology/facebook-owner-meta-adds-tool-guard-against-harassment-metaverse-2022-02-04/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eblock avatars\u003c/a\u003e from invading a nearly four-foot perimeter around your virtual character in its Horizon VR experiences. Avatars will be halted upon approach and have to “extend their arms to be able to high-five or fist bump” \u003cem\u003eCreation of Adam\u003c/em\u003e-style.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhy is it taking this action? Well, harassment has \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-60247542?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emade its way\u003c/a\u003e from the realverse → metaverse.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBloomberg tech reporter Parmy Olson told the BBC that male avatars in Horizon Worlds swarmed around her, stared, took pics, and “zoomed up” to talk directly in her ear.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnother woman, Nina Jane Patel, told the Daily Mail she was sexually assualted in Horizon Venues by male avatars who groped her.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eMeta has a storied history of attempting to moderate its social platforms, and digital worlds add another dimension of complexity. CTO Andrew Bosworth told the BBC last year that it “could feel a lot more real to me, if you were being abusive towards me,” but on the flip side, users have the power to mute each other so “you would cease to exist for me and your ability to do harm to me is immediately nullified.”\u003cem\u003e—JW\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s not delivery, it’s Di-do it yourself. Domino’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/business/2022/feb/03/dominos-pizza-offers-customers-tips-pick-up-own-pizza?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e this week that customers could earn a $3 “tip” to put toward their next order if they choose takeout instead of delivery.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe largest pizza company in the world isn’t just missing your beautiful face in its stores—the promo comes as the chain is still struggling to hire enough delivery drivers. Last year, CEO Richard Allison blamed staffing shortages (specifically a lack of drivers) for same-store sales falling 1.9% in Q3—the first time quarterly sales dropped since 2011.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDigital orders make up 50% of Domino’s sales. Delivery accounts for about two-thirds of those orders, while one-third are takeout.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBacked into a takeout corner.\u003c/strong\u003e The pivot to pickup is really Domino’s only choice. While you can get Little Caesars or Papa John’s on Uber Eats, Domino’s has made it their thing to be anti-delivery apps. Last year the chain handed out over $100,000 in gift cards to random delivery customers for \u003cem\u003eother\u003c/em\u003e local restaurants to highlight the third-party delivery fees that smaller restaurants pay. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnother cost-cutting measure…\u003c/strong\u003ethe chain also took away some of your chicken wings.
